intro: Macromeria exserta var. imparata, commonly known as the roughleaf macromeria, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and typically wind-pollinated flowers. The plant features elongated, narrow leaves with a rough, hairy texture, giving it its common name. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, arranged in clusters, and bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
